headline: A Case Study in Poor Leadership
pros: There is no shortage of work at Acadian, you will gain experience quickly in whichever role you take. This should be seen as a positive. Separately, the benefits are generous.
cons:
Acadian’s culture was very disappointing. For a world class asset manager, I would expect the culture to be inclusive, supportive, and respectful. Unfortunately, the environment was toxic, which stemmed from the top. I saw countless examples where management allowed poor behavior of their subordinates to continue. This was unfortunate, as it fostered a toxic environment for many employees. It was one thing to demand excellence, it is another to berate your employees. 

Additionally, as a company who prides itself on being diverse, inclusive leadership is nonexistent. There is no healthy debate of opinions – in fact, if you do not share the same sentiment as leadership, you are essentially blacklisted in your career. This is not the type of environment that will retain employees.

headline: Acadian is performative.
pros: Hard to find any pros.
cons:
Acadian has an EVP who now writes columns on their website about how she champions women and supports women in the workplace, however she was responsible for a re-org at the firm that laid off 5 senior women, and several other junior women at the end of 2019. 

Her recent post states: "In last year’s post, I noted the importance of building the pipeline to lay the groundwork for greater female representation at the senior levels, by supporting women at a much earlier stage in their careers than the industry historically has."

At the layoff, Acadian had less than 20 senior women. The EVP does not care about women empowerment and neither does the company.

headline: Best place that I have ever worked!
pros:
- Management really cares about developing employees, both personally and professionally
- Open and welcoming learning environment where people are encouraged to learn for the sake of it, not pressured to stay in lane
- Kind and compassionate coworkers, most with a solid sense of humor
- Colleagues have a genuine interest in quantitative investments and coding
- Lots of company, department, and team social events with great food and drink. Did I mention the time they took everyone and their families one of the swankiest ski resorts in northern Vermont? They don't mess around. They want you to be colleagues and friends across the company, and they make it fun and tasty!
cons:
-As with any finance company, there are those who engage in ego wrestling matches and make their advances at others' expense
-Some people forget that it is small shop, team effort that makes Acadian special and try to steer the company in the direction of becoming just another Boston Brahmin investment company
